data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_LinkedRow
data.value: Please note that the desired row cannot be renamed since the same row exists in Accounts Pro.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblHeading_FavouriteList
data.value: Favourite Speedometer List from current plan

data.name: bizplan_Services_Plan_SpeedometerManager_lblMsg
data.value: This is a list of all the Speedometers from the plan:Untitled Plan.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblsuggestion_StartWizard
data.value: Click Next button to start the Speedometer Wizard

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblsuggestion_SelectAnalysisType
data.value: Select the desired type of analysis. Click Next button to continue

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblsuggestion_SelectSpeedometerType
data.value: Select the desired type of Speedometer. Click Next button to continue

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblsuggestion_SelectProductType
data.value: Select the desired product or service and save the Speedometer

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_helpTextStart
data.value: The Speedometer Wizard helps you create Speedometers for your business plan. A Speedometer gives you an analysis of the plan you created. It compares the data entered at the time of plan creation with the actual sales and expenses records within your accounts.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_helpTextCriteria
data.value: In this step you can select the type of analysis for the Speedometer. Different types give analysis about different aspects of your plan

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_helpTextSelectEntity
data.value: In this step you can select a desired product(s) or service(s) to analyse its performance. You can only select one product or service if you are creating an Estimate or Deviation Speedometer. However the speedometer with Actual as the speedometer type can have multiple products or services selected simultaneously.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_helpTextClip
data.value: In this step you can select the type of Speedometer. Different types present the analysis from different perspectives.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblClipHeading
data.value:
This is a list of all the Speedometers from the plan:Untitled Plan

To add a Speedometer to the Favourites List, click on the Add to Favourites link under the Speedometer

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_lblnotfavorites
data.value:
The Favourites List is empty.

To add a Speedometer to the list, click the Add to Favourites link on Meter Listing page.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_MeterWizard_MeterWizard_Label1
data.value: This is a list of all the Favouritespeedometers from this plan. Click on a Speedometer name to remove it from the list

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Meter_PlanMeter_lblFirstHelp
data.value: In order to use the Meter Wizard feature, the currency used in a plan must be the same as the currency selected in your Accounts Centre Profile.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_faqs_lblFAQs
data.value:
How do I log in to InfiniPlan?

  1. Log on to www.accountscentre.com and click My Account.
  2. Enter your Customer ID and Password to access the Unified Login Page.
  3. Click the Accounting Services icon.
  4. Click the Available Services menu and select InfiniPlan.
  5. You have successfully logged in to InfiniPlan and can now start preparing your business plan / summary.

How do I begin using InfiniPlan?

Once you have logged in to InfiniPlan, you can use one of the following options to start the planning process and navigate through the application:

  1. Click the Start button to access Plan Manager and begin the planning process.
  2. Or go to the Plan Navigator menu on the left side of the page and click your desired option.

What is Plan Navigator?

Plan Navigator is a navigational menu which allows the users to browse through the application and access different components. It is available on the upper left side of InfiniPlan home page and displays the following four options:

  1. Home : Default page of the product
  2. Plan Manager: Manages operations like plan creation, selection and modification.
  3. Exported Plan: Manages the list of already exported plans.
  4. FAQ’s: Frequently asked questions related to product

What are the options of Plan Manager?

However, once an already created or sample plan is accessed, the Plan Manager displays the following options.

  1. Texts: this takes the user to the Text contents of a Plan.
  2. Tables: this takes the user to the different plan tables.
  3. Charts: this takes the user to Plan charts
  4. Plan Preview: this enables the user to preview the plan and finalize the format.
  5. Export Plan: this enables the user to export plans for use in other applications such as Microsoft Word and print them.
  6. Plan Wizard (explained in chapter 3): this takes the user to the Plan Wizard which was used during the creation of this particular plan and allows editing of any previously entered information.
  7. Close Plan: this closes the existing plan and takes the user back to InfiniPlan home page.

How do I create a new plan?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the Create New Plan icon.
  3. This will take you to the InfiniPlan Wizard with an introduction to the Wizard. Click the button marked Next to start creating a business plan.
  4. Select the Basic or Advanced wizard option and click Next.
  5. Select your Business type and click Next. The Services option is selected by default, however, in this help text the Plan is generated by selecting the option marked.
  6. Select if you manage any inventory or not and click Next. Yes is selected by default.
  7. Select your annual inventory turnover and click Next (the value has to be estimated on the basis of business objectives and strategies).
  8. Decide on credit sales option by selecting Yes or No and click Next.
  9. Enter the expected percentage of Credit Sales and click Next.
  10. Enter the expected number of collection days and click Next.
  11. Select the Sales Forecast Type (i.e. by unit or by value) and click Next. Sales Forecast based on value is selected by default.
  12. Select if you wish to categorize your expenses functionally and click Next.
  13. Enter the expected percentage of personal burden i.e. any salaries or benefits you bear for your employees and click Next.
  14. Enter the estimated short term interest rate and click Next.
  15. Enter an estimated long term interest rate and click Next.
  16. Enter an estimated tax rate applicable on your business activities and click Next.
  17. Enter the percentage of nonpayroll expense and click Next.
  18. Enter your expected Payment Days and click next.
  19. Select if you are creating a Plan for a Start up or an Ongoing business and click Next.
  20. Enter the date you wish your plan to start from and click Next.
  21. Enter a Plan Title and click Next.
  22. Enter a brief Plan Description regarding goals & objectives(this is optional) and click Next.
  23. Click the button marked Finish to create the plan.

This will take you to the Plan Navigator for this Plan where you can browse through the plan components and make any modifications.

How do I access the last plan I was working on?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the Continue Last Plan icon.

It will take you directly to the last plan you were working on. Please use the Plan Navigator option to access, view and modify the plan.

How do I open existing Plans?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the Open Existing Plan icon.

A list of existing plans will be displayed. Click the desired plan to open it.

Plan Navigator will open for your selected plan. Select your desired options to proceed further.

Are there any sample plans that I can use as a reference?

There are a number of sample plans available within InfiniPlan to be used as a reference. Follow the steps given below to access these sample plans.

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the Open Sample Plan icon.

Select the desired sample plan to open it.

The Plan Navigator for this sample plan will be opened. Select the desired option to proceed further and browse through the sample plan.

How do I access the text module and its components?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the open existing plan icon.
  3. Select the desired plan from the list of plans displayed.
  4. This will take you to the Plan Navigator for your selected plan.
  5. Select the Text option displayed under the Plan navigator menu on the left side of the page.
  6. A new panel labelled as Plan Texts will appear on the lower left hand side of the page below the Plan Navigator menu.
  7. The selected text component will open.

Please note that if the text component is accessed for a sample plan, it will have the relevant data in it. For all newly created plans, empty text components will be displayed, where users can add their own data. Other text components can be accessed in the same manner.

How do I customize the plan text?

Please access the desired text component by following the instructions given in the above mentioned question. Once you have opened the desired text component you can easily customize it by adding text to it.

Most of the text components that require detailed description have been equipped with font and format editing tools e.g. Legal Page

Add the required information (for newly created plans) or edit the information already there (for sample plans) and click the Update Text button to save any changes you make.

How do I access the Plan Tables?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the open existing plan icon.
  3. Select the desired plan from the list of plans displayed.
  4. This will take you to the Plan Navigator for your selected plan.
  5. Click the Tables option in the Plan Navigator menu to access the table module.

A new panel labelled as Plan Tables will open below the Plan Navigator panel

How do I edit / customize the plan tables?

Please access the desired plan table you wish to edit / customize, by following the steps given in the abovementioned question. Some tables can not be edited or customized depending on the type of data they contain. You can add, delete or insert rows to a table. Click the ‘Update Table’ button to save any changes you have made

How do I access the charts in my business plan?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the open existing plan icon.
  3. Select the desired plan from the list of plans displayed.
  4. This will take you to the Plan Navigator for your selected plan.
  5. Click the Charts option in the Plan Navigator menu to access the table module.
  6. A new panel labeled as Plan Charts will open below the Plan Navigator panel with a list of all available charts. Select your desired chart to access it your selected chart will be displayed.

How do I change the type of a chart?

Please access the desired chart by following the steps in the abovementioned question. There is box labeled as chart type on top of every chart. Click on the arrow and a list of all available chart types will be displayed. Select your desired chart type and the new chart will be displayed.

How do I edit the plan charts?

All charts are drawn on the basis of data entered by the user in the Plan Wizard. If you wish to change any of the charts, please make changes in the relevant tables or wizard section You can access the desired table or plan wizard by selecting the Tables or Plan Wizard option from the Plan Navigator Panel respectively.

How do I preview the Plan I created?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the open existing plan icon.
  3. Select the desired plan from the list of plans displayed.
  4. This will take you to the Plan Navigator for your selected plan.
  5. Click the Plan Preview option within the Plan Navigator menu.

A new explorer window will open showing the plan preview (left side of the explorer window shows the Plan outline and the plan contents are displayed on the right side)

Can I export the plans created within InfiniPlan?

Yes, you can export the plans created within InfiniPlan. These exported plans can be saved in your computer’s hard disk and will be available offline for printing or other purposes.

How do I export a plan?

  1. Click the Plan Manager option under the Plan Navigator menu.
  2. Click the open existing plan icon.
  3. Select the desired plan from the list of plans displayed.
  4. This will take you to the Plan Navigator for your selected plan.
  5. Click the Plan Preview option within the Plan Navigator panel.

A window displaying Plan Export Options will open. Select Yes if you wish to include plans and charts in the exported plan. Select the check box labelled as download immediately and click the Export Plan button. A small window will open with an option to open or save the exported plan. Choose the desired option to complete the export procedure.

Can I create and save more than one plans within InfiniPlan?

Yes, you can create and save more than one plan within InfiniPlan at one time.

Is there any limit defined for the maximum number of plans that can be created within InfiniPlan?

No, there is no set limit for the maximum number of plans that can be created and saved within InfiniPlan. You can create as many plans as you need.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_home_txtText1
data.value:
An important step in starting your own business is to develop a business plan. The plan will help you define what your business is all about, how you are
going to market your product, and how your business will operate.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_home_txtText2
data.value: “A business plan is an essential step for any prudent entrepreneur to take, regardless of the size of the business.” “Business plan describes the business, its objectives, its strategies, the market it is in and its financial forecasts. It has many functions, from securing external funding to measuring success within your business.”

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_home_txtText3
data.value:
“InfiniPlan is having summary of how a business owner, manager, or entrepreneur intends to organize an entrepreneurial endeavor and implement
activities necessary and sufficient for the venture to succeed.”

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblIntro1
data.value:
InfiniPlan allows you to create a comprehensive summary/plan of your proposed company's business model. Such a summary can be used as an internal
management, planning and strategy tool or externally, as a corporate summary for banks or other potential investors. InfiniPlan can be used again and again to create
up-to-date business plans, for your current or proposed ventures.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblIntro2
data.value:
The business plan created using InfiniPlan contains all the relevant texts and tables, which describe your business aims. You can also add any number of
charts and figures to illustrate the forecasts and financial analyses in your business plan.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblIntro3
data.value: InfiniPlan offers the following, ease-of-use features, to help you create the ideal plan for your business:

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblIntro4
bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblCoverPage
data.value: This page displays the company name, logo, address and other contact and relevant details.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblLegalPage
data.value: This page includes statements regarding the copyright protection of the given information.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblExecutiveSummary
data.value:
This section provides the relevant facts and figures for the proposed business venture, such as the prospective sales growth and
profitability. It also defines the company objectives and mission statement. Finally it provides a comprehensive summary of all the proposed goals and strategic foci that the business will possess.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblCompanySummary
data.value:
This section provides the details of company owner ship, as well as the financial details at the time of business start up and other
related/linked company facilities and businesses.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblServices
data.value:
This section provides information of the proposed products and services to be provided by the business. It also outlines the
proposed sales strategy and the future forecasting related to sales and growth of the product. In addition it also provides an up-to-date
competitive comparison as well as detail the use of incorporated technology in the sales strategy.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblMarketAnalysisSummary
data.value: This section focuses on determining the number of potential customers and the market share for the proposed business.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblStrategyandImplementationSummary
data.value:
This section provides the details of the proposed pricing and sales strategy. It also describes the planned milestones and
strategic alliances.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblManagementSummary
data.value: This section provides details of the proposed organization plans, structural hierarchy and work flow.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_text_plantext_lblFinancialPlan
data.value:
This section provides summarized information of the financial estimates and assumptions, through forecasting, borrowing and
projections related to balance sheet, cash flow, profit and loss and other financial statements.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_savesampleplan_lblSavePlan
data.value: Would you like to save the sample plan you imported?

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_savesampleplan_lblOverwritePlan
data.value: A plan with the same name already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblTableInto
data.value:
InfiniPlan includes a complete set of analysis’ tables. The tables appear and operate similar to spreadsheets; however, for your convenience these
are preprogrammed. To use, simply enter your data in the correct cells and the results will be calculated automatically.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblGeneralAssumption
data.value:
In order to create this table, answer the questions in the Plan Wizard. The results are calculated, according to the accepted accounting
standards, from your input.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblStartupDetails
data.value:
This table helps you estimate the start-up costs for your proposed business venture. It also automatically uploads your starting balances into the
Balance Sheet.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblBreakEvenAnalysis
data.value:
This table helps you determine your business’ break-even point: that is, which product you need to sell in what quantity, monthly or
annually, to cover your costs of doing business.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblBreakEvenAnalysis
data.value:
This table helps you determine your business’ break-even point: that is, which product you need to sell in what
quantity, monthly or annually, to cover your costs of doing business.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblMarketAnalysis
data.value:
This table deals with the number of potential customers in your market segments. Using such projected figures, this table helps to quantify the
total potential market.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblPayroll
data.value: This table uses the entered number of employees that your business intends to employ and then calculates the total projected expenses for the work

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblSalesForecast
data.value:
This table estimates the cost of sales from the number of planned sales. This estimate is initially made on a monthly basis (for the first planned
year), however, for the subsequent years it is made on annual basis.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblMileStones
data.value: This table provides a simplified list of specific, concrete steps, which may be taken during the implementation of the business plan.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblIncomeStatement
data.value:
This table creates the Profit and Loss Statement (also known as the ‘Pro-forma Income Statement’), which overviews the planned profit
and loss for the proposed business. The table gathers information from the Sales Forecast, the Payroll and the Balance Sheet tables and conversely, automatically
affects the Cash Flow Statement, the Balance Sheet and the Performance Ratios.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblCashFlow
data.value: This table forecasts the change in the cash balance, over a given time period.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblBalanceSheet
data.value: This table lists the cash, assets and liabilities of the given business, present at a specified time.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_lblRatios
data.value: This table automatically calculates the Performance Ratios of the proposed business, given the values of the earlier tables.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblChartIntro1
data.value:
InfiniPlan automatically creates suitable charts for use in your business plans, from the data you enter in your tables.
These charts can be modified and customized to suit your overall plan theme and requirements.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblBenchMark
data.value: This chart displays the values of sales, gross profit, operating expenses as well as the Accounts Receivables.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblCashFlow
data.value:
This chart displays the change in the cash balance, over a given time period, graphically. It is based on the earlier Cash
Flow table.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblHighlights
data.value:
This chart displays an over view of the key financial projection in terms of sales, gross profit and net profit earned over a
specific period (usually three years).

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblMarketAnalysis
data.value:
This table displays the number of potential customers in the market segments. It is based on the earlier Market
Analysis table.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblStartup
data.value: This table displays the data entered in the earlier Start Up details table.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblProfitMonthly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected monthly profits, based on the assumed total monthly sales.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblProfitYearly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected annual profits, based on the assumed total annual sales.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblGrossMarginMonthly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected gross monthly profits, based on the assumed total monthly sales.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblGrossMarginYearly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected gross annual profits, based on the assumed total annual sales.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblSalesYearly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected number of annual sales.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_charts_chart_lblSalesMonthly
data.value: This table graphically displays the projected number of monthly sales.

data.name: PW_Text_BusinessType
data.value: Are you in the business of selling products, providing services or both?

data.name: PW_Help_BusinessType
data.value: This section requires you to classify your (proposed) business according to its function. If your company buys, sells or produces tangible items, the kindly choose ‘Products’; if the company provides a service of some kind (for example, a gardening company), kindly choose ‘Services’. In case your company provides both the products and the services (example, plants, fertilizers and gardening expertise), choose ‘Both’. If you are unsure, you may skip this step at this point (press ‘Next’) and return to it later.

data.name: PW_Help_ManageInventory
data.value: If in the previous step, you chose ‘Products’, or ‘Both’, it means that your company deals with products and maintains (aims to maintain) an inventory. This may be a purchase(s), receivable(s) or manufacture inventory. To add an inventory line to the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables in your business plan, choose ‘Yes’.

data.name: PW_Text_InventoryTurnOver
data.value: How many times you turn your inventory per year?

data.name: PW_Help_InventoryTurnOver
data.value: If in the previous step you choose ‘Yes’, it means that your business regularly maintains and replaces items in your inventory. In order to determine the value of inventory turnover, simply list the total number of times you completely replace your inventory each year. For example, if you replace your inventory 6 times annually, then 6 is your inventory turnover estimate value. The inventory turnover estimate value is used in the Balance Sheet and will affect the Inventory row.

data.name: PW_Text_SellOnCredit
data.value: Do you sell to your customers on credit?

data.name: PW_Help_SellOnCredit
data.value: In case your customers require credit when they purchase your service/product, choose ‘Yes’ and an entry will be made in the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables for the Accounts Receivable. If your business does not extend credit, kindly choose ‘No’.

data.name: PW_Text_SalesOnCredit
data.value: What percentage of your sales are sold on credit?

data.name: PW_Help_SalesOnCredit
data.value: If in the previous step you choose ‘Yes’, it means that your business regularly extends credit to the customers. The next step is to determine the percentage of your sales which is sold on credit. This value is the result of dividing the number of services/products sold on credit divided by the total number of services/products sold and the result multiplied by 100. The resultant value will be placed in the Sales on Credit % (percentage) row in your General Assumptions table.

data.name: PW_Text_CollectionDays
data.value: In how many days, do you get paid on your credit sales?

data.name: PW_Help_CollectionDays
data.value: If in step 5 you choose ‘Yes’, an entry was made for the Accounts Receivable in the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables of your business plan. To calculate your accounts receivable accurately, kindly enter the number of days you wait before collecting on your credit sales. This number will be used to complete the Collection Days Estimate row in your General Assumptions table.

data.name: PW_Text_SalesForcastType
data.value: Do you want to forecast your sales by units or by value?

data.name: PW_Help_SalesForcastType
data.value: There are two available options for forecasting sales: by units or by sales. In case you choose to forecast your sales by units, your total sales will be calculated by multiplying the number of units sold by the associated price. In case you wish to forecast the sales by value, simply choose the forecast by values button. If you are unsure of your choice or wish to later make a change, you can always return to this page later.

data.name: PW_Text_CategorizedExpenses
data.value: Do you want to categorize your operating expenses functionally?

data.name: PW_Help_CategorizedExpenses
data.value: If you wish to keep the financial projections simple, just choose ‘No’ to create a simple list of expenses and a simple personnel plan. The choice of ‘Yes’ divides the expenses and personnel plan into operational categories such as sales and marketing expenses, general and administrative expenses, etc.

data.name: PW_Text_PersonalBurden
data.value: What percent of salaries do you bear for your employees additionally? such as taxes, vacations and benefits.

data.name: PW_Help_PersonalBurden
data.value: Personnel Burden is the name given to the additional cost beyond salaries and can run from 10 to 30 percent depending upon the industry and your company policies. If you do not employ any employees set this value to zero. In case you are not certain, enter a value of 15 percent. This value will be used in the Personnel Burden line in the General Assumptions table as well as added to the Personnel and the Profit and Loss tables.

data.name: PW_Help_ShortTermInterestRate
data.value: This step requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. The short-term interest rate is a number (expressed as a percentage) which is used to calculate your short-term interest expense which appears in the Profit and Loss table and the General Assumptions table. You may later return to this step and edit the number to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Help_TaxRate
data.value: This step again requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. Kindly provide a reasonable (in view of your proposed business activities) tax rate at which your profits will be taxed: in case you are unsure, guess 25 percent. The rate provided here will be used to complete the General Assumptions table. You can later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see the impact it has on your financials.

data.name: PW_Text_NonPayrollExpense
data.value: What percent of your non-payroll expense, do you pay in cash?

data.name: PW_Help_NonPayrollExpense
data.value: This step again requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. The Non Payroll Expense is usually a low number expressed as a percentage and used to estimate your accounts payable in the Balance Sheet. This number will be used to complete the General Assumptions table in your business plan. You may later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Text_PaymentDays
data.value: In how many days, do you pay your bills?

data.name: PW_Help_PaymentDays
data.value: The number you enter here will be used to complete the row titled ‘Payment Days Estimator’ in the General Assumptions table in your business plan. You may later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Text_StartupOngoing
data.value: Are you planning for a startup business or an ongoing business?

data.name: PW_Help_StartupOngoing
data.value: The InfiniPlan wizard helps you create business plans whether your company is newly registered start-up or a previously existent company. For start-up companies, kindly choose ‘Startup’ and a table titled Start-up will be created where starting numbers for the company can be input. For the existing businesses, choose ‘Ongoing’ and a table called Past Performance will be created containing the historical information of the company.

data.name: PW_Text_PlanStartDate
data.value: When do you want to start your plan?

data.name: PW_Help_PlanStartDate
data.value: Kindly choose the date which you desire to display on all your financial tables.

data.name: PW_Help_StandardLongTerm
data.value: I recommend a standard-term for most business plans. A standard-term business plan consists of 12 months of monthly forecasting and an additional two years of annual forecasting. A long-term plan adds two years of additional forecasting for a total of five years. Most business planners should stick to the standard-term. (Copied from Business Plan Pro)

data.name: PW_Text_PlanTitle
data.value: Give a suitable title to your plan.

data.name: PW_Help_PlanTitle
data.value: Kindly choose a name for your business plan, which will appear as title on the header of all the pages, including the cover page.

data.name: PW_Help_LongTermInterestRate
data.value: This step requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. The long-term interest rate you provide here will be used to calculate the long-term interest expense which will appear in the Profit and Loss table. This number can later be edited to see its impact on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Text_PlanDescription
data.value: Describe your plan in a few words.

data.name: PW_Help_PlanDescription
data.value: Kindly use the provided space to give any additional information about your (proposed) business that describes its purpose and goals briefly.

data.name: PW_Text_BBusinessType
data.value: Are you in the business of selling products, providing services or both?

data.name: PW_Help_BBusinessType
data.value: This section requires you to classify your (proposed) business according to its function. If your company buys, sells or produces tangible items, the kindly choose ‘Products’; if the company provides a service of some kind (for example, a gardening company), kindly choose ‘Services’. In case your company provides both the products and the services (example, plants, fertilizers and gardening expertise), choose ‘Both’. If you are unsure, you may skip this step at this point (press ‘Next’) and return to it later.

data.name: PW_Help_BManageInventory
data.value: If in the previous step, you chose ‘Products’, or ‘Both’, it means that your company deals with products and maintains (aims to maintain) an inventory. This may be a purchase(s), receivable(s) or manufacture inventory. To add an inventory line to the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables in your business plan, choose ‘Yes’.

data.name: PW_Text_BInventoryTurnOver
data.value: How many times you turn your inventory per year?

data.name: PW_Help_BInventoryTurnOver
data.value: If in the previous step you choose ‘Yes’, it means that your business regularly maintains and replaces items in your inventory. In order to determine the value of inventory turnover, simply list the total number of times you completely replace your inventory each year. For example, if you replace your inventory 6 times annually, then 6 is your inventory turnover estimate value. The inventory turnover estimate value is used in the Balance Sheet and will affect the Inventory row.

data.name: PW_Text_BSellOnCredit
data.value: Do you sell to your customers on credit?

data.name: PW_Help_BSellOnCredit
data.value: In case your customers require credit when they purchase your service/product, choose ‘Yes’ and an entry will be made in the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables for the Accounts Receivable. If your business does not extend credit, kindly choose ‘No’.

data.name: PW_Text_BSalesOnCredit
data.value: What percentage of your sales are sold on credit?

data.name: PW_Help_BSalesOnCredit
data.value: If in the previous step you choose ‘Yes’, it means that your business regularly extends credit to the customers. The next step is to determine the percentage of your sales which is sold on credit. This value is the result of dividing the number of services/products sold on credit divided by the total number of services/products sold and the result multiplied by 100. The resultant value will be placed in the Sales on Credit % (percentage) row in your General Assumptions table

data.name: PW_Text_BCollectionDays
data.value: In how many days, do you get paid on your credit sales?

data.name: PW_Help_BCollectionDays
data.value: If in step 5 you choose ‘Yes’, an entry was made for the Accounts Receivable in the Balance Sheet and Cash Flow tables of your business plan. To calculate your accounts receivable accurately, kindly enter the number of days you wait before collecting on your credit sales. This number will be used to complete the Collection Days Estimate row in your General Assumptions table.

data.name: PW_Text_BSalesForcastType
data.value: Do you want to forecast your sales by units or by value?

data.name: PW_Help_BSalesForcastType
data.value: There are two available options for forecasting sales: by units or by sales. In case you choose to forecast your sales by units, your total sales will be calculated by multiplying the number of units sold by the associated price. In case you wish to forecast the sales by value, simply choose the forecast by values button. If you are unsure of your choice or wish to later make a change, you can always return to this page later.

data.name: PW_Text_BPersonalBurden
data.value: What percent of salaries do you bear for your employees additionally? such as taxes, vacations and benefits.

data.name: PW_Help_BPersonalBurden
data.value: Personnel Burden is the name given to the additional cost beyond salaries and can run from 10 to 30 percent depending upon the industry and your company policies. If you do not employ any employees set this value to zero. In case you are not certain, enter a value of 15 percent. This value will be used in the Personnel Burden line in the General Assumptions table as well as added to the Personnel and the Profit and Loss tables

data.name: PW_Help_BInterestRate
data.value: This step requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. The short-term interest rate is a number (expressed as a percentage) which is used to calculate your short-term interest expense which appears in the Profit and Loss table and the General Assumptions table. You may later return to this step and edit the number to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Help_BTaxRate
data.value: This step again requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. Kindly provide a reasonable (in view of your proposed business activities) tax rate at which your profits will be taxed: in case you are unsure, guess 25 percent. The rate provided here will be used to complete the General Assumptions table. You can later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see the impact it has on your financials.

data.name: PW_Text_BNonPayrollExpense
data.value: What percent of your non-payroll expense, do you pay in cash?

data.name: PW_Help_BNonPayrollExpense
data.value: This step again requires you to make an educated guess about the future prospects of your company. The Non Payroll Expense is usually a low number expressed as a percentage and used to estimate your accounts payable in the Balance Sheet. This number will be used to complete the General Assumptions table in your business plan. You may later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Text_BPaymentDays
data.value: In how many days, do you pay your bills?

data.name: PW_Help_BPaymentDays
data.value: The number you enter here will be used to complete the row titled ‘Payment Days Estimator’ in the General Assumptions table in your business plan. You may later manipulate this number in your General Assumptions table to see its impact on your on your (projected) financials.

data.name: PW_Text_BStartupOngoing
data.value: Are you planning for a startup business or an ongoing business?

data.name: PW_Help_BStartupOngoing
data.value: The InfiniPlan wizard helps you create business plans whether your company is newly registered start-up or a previously existent company. For start-up companies, kindly choose ‘Startup’ and a table titled Start-up will be created where starting numbers for the company can be input. For the existing businesses, choose ‘Ongoing’ and a table called Past Performance will be created containing the historical information of the company.

data.name: PW_Text_BPlanStartDate
data.value: When do you want to start your plan?

data.name: PW_Help_BPlanStartDate
data.value: Kindly choose the date which you desire to display on all your financial tables

data.name: PW_Text_BPlanTitle
data.value: Give a suitable title to your plan.

data.name: PW_Help_BPlanTitle
data.value: Kindly choose a name for your business plan, which will appear as title on the header of all the pages, including the cover page.

data.name: PW_Text_BPlanDescription
data.value: Describe your plan in a few words.

data.name: PW_Help_BPlanDescription
data.value: Kindly use the provided space to give any additional information about your (proposed) business that describes its purpose and goals briefly.

data.name: PW_Error_PlanAlreadyExists
data.value: Please note that a plan with the same name exists. Click yes to replace the existing plan.

data.name: PW_Text_BasicAdvanced
data.value: Start with a basic wizard or advanced wizard?

data.name: PW_Help_BasicAdvanced
data.value: The InfiniPlan wizard helps you create basic as well as advanced versions of your business plan. In the basic mode, you answer fewer questions and the generic (assumed) values are used to create an equivocal business plan. Using the advanced mode of the wizard, you may specify all the information you desire to include in your business plan. In either case, you may always return to the wizard to edit the any of the various tables, charts and figures according to your requirements, irrespective of whether you chose the basic or the advanced wizard initially.

data.name: PW_Help_Finish
data.value: Congratulations! You have reached the end of the InfiniPlan wizard. To create and view your business plan, please click ‘Finish’. To review or edit the information you have provided so far, kindly press the ‘Back’ button to reach your desired step. Once you have made your changes, simply press the ‘Finish’ button to directly view your business plan.

data.name: PW_Help_Start
data.value: Welcome to the InfiniPlan wizard. This wizard will help you create your business plan, simply and easily. Kindly answer the following simple questions and based on your answers, the wizard will create your business plan. There are certain default values provided in certain answers, however, you may easily change them to customize your plan. Alternatively, you may also later return to the wizard to edit the any of the various tables, charts and figures according to your requirements.

data.name: PW_Text_Finish
data.value: Press the finish button to create plan.

data.name: PW_Text_Start
data.value: Press the next buton to start the wizard.

data.name: PW_Text_PlanParticulars
data.value: Please provide the following particulars about your plan which will be displayed on the cover page of the final document.

data.name: PW_Help_BCurrency
data.value: You can select your preferred currency that you use for your business activity. The symbol and ISO code for your selected currency will be shown with all figures representing money.

data.name: PW_Help_Currency
data.value: You can select your preferred currency that you use for your business activity. The symbol and ISO code for your selected currency will be shown with all figures representing money.

data.name: bizplan_error_yes_lblErrorMessage
data.value: Please note that the table cannot be updated due to some technical errors. Please try again.

data.name: bizplan_error_name_lblErrorMessage
data.value: The row could not be inserted because the name was invalid

data.name: bizplan_planpreferences_lblErrorMessage1
data.value: Your selected plan cannot be exported due to some technical errors. Please try again.

data.name: bizplan_planpreferences_lblErrorMessage2
data.value: Plan has been exported and saved successfully.

data.name: bizplan_planpreferences_lblErrorMessage3
data.value: Plan has not been exported due to some tachnical error.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_DeleteError
data.value: Please note that a standard row cannot be deleted.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_CellDeleteError
data.value: Deletion not allowed on Selected cell.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_CellRenameError
data.value: Rename Operation is not allowed on selected cell.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_RowSelectError
data.value: Select any Row prior to Insert Operation.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_CellInsertError
data.value: Insertion is not allowed on Selected cell.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_InsertError
data.value: Please note that this table can only have standard rows and no new rows can be inserted.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_RowExsistError
data.value: Please note that a row already exists with the same name.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_InvalidNameError
data.value: The row could not be Inserted because the name was invalid.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_InvalidReNameError
data.value: The row could not be Rename because the name was invalid.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_plan_planmanager_InvalidData
data.value: Invalid data. Please check the values entered.

data.name: BizPlanWeb_Services_PlanOutLine_PlanOutLine_lblHelp
data.value:
Insert: Use this option to insert a new text component adjacent to the selected part (create component) or within the selected part (create sub-component ).

Rename: Use this option to rename any selected part (except for tables and charts) of the plan.

Restore: Use this option to restore plan outline to its original state, erasing all the changes made to the plan.

Delete: Use this option to delete any selected component (except for charts, tables and component with subcomponent ) of the plan.

Please select the desired operation.

Create Component

Create Sub-Component

data.name: BizPlanWeb_Services_PlanOutLine_PlanOutLine_lblHelpHeading
data.value: To delete an option, please first select the heading. To undo the deletions, please click the "Restore" button.

data.name: BizPlanWeb_Services_PlanOutLine_PlanOutLine_exception_Delete
data.value: Heading may has Subheading(s), Delete Aborted

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblPlanTrackerTitle
data.value: Track the achievement of your business goals!

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblFirstHelp
data.value: In order to use the Business Tracker feature, the currency used in a plan must be the same as the currency selected in your Accounts Centre Profile.

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblSecondHelp
data.value: Please use the Plan Wizard to change the currency of your business plan ( ) according to your Accounts Centre Profile ( ).

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblStandardHead
data.value: Standard Reports help you track deviations from your business plan.

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblIO
data.value:
Monthly Income Statement This report compares the actual income and expense of your business with the estimated figures on monthly basis.

Yearly Income Statement The Yearly Income Statement gives you an yearly based comparison of your actual income statement with your estimated figures.

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Tracker_PlanTracker_lblBS
data.value:
Monthly Balance Sheet The Monthly Balance Sheet compares your actual balance sheet with the expected balance sheet on monthly basis.

Yearly Balance Sheet This report gives you a yearly based comparison of the actual balance sheet and your expected balance sheet.

data.name: bizplanweb_services_tables_table_msg
data.value: There is no record to import or You already import exsisting records .

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Plan_Tables_SaleForCost_lblSearchRecordMessage
data.value: Enter (Id or Name) in search criteria OR select records from below list.

data.name: BizPlan_Services_Plan_SearchPlan_Plan_lblError2
data.value: The plan with the given name does not exist.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_Business Tracker_PlanTracker_lblMonthlychart
data.value:
Monthly Charts Monthly Charts compare your actual financial data and the expected figures on monthly basis.

Please select the desired month and the chart type from the drop-down menu and click the button marked Show.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_Business Tracker_PlanTracker_lblAnnaulchart
data.value:
Annual Charts Annual Charts compare your actual financial data and the expected figures on yearly basis.

Please select the desired year from the drop-down menu and click the button marked Show.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_Business Tracker_PlanTracker_lblChartSelection
data.value: Please select the desired option and click the button marked Ok.

data.name: bizplanweb_Services_Business Tracker_PlanTracker_lblChartHelp
data.value:
Charts prove to be helpful when you wish to have a quick look at the financial status of your business. They provide you with a snap shot of the status of your business against your estimations.

The Chart option in Business Tracker generates charts based on your company’s actual financial data and your estimated figures. These charts reflect different aspects of your business on monthly as well as annual basis. The charts are available in variety of different formats which help you make the most out of the data.
